question.text: For per gram of reactant, the maximum quantity of $\mathrm{N}_2$ gas is produced in which of the following thermal decomposition reactions? (Given: Atomic wt. : $\mathrm{Cr}=52 \mathrm{u}, \mathrm{Ba}=137 \mathrm{u}$ ).

solution.text:
(a) Molar mass of Ba $\left(\mathrm{N}_3\right)_2(\mathrm{~s})=221 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{mol}$ 1 mole of $\mathrm{Ba}\left(\mathrm{N}_3\right)_2(\mathrm{~s})$ will give 3 moles of $\mathrm{N}_2$ hence $\frac{1 \mathrm{~g}}{221 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{mol}}$ moles of $\mathrm{Ba}\left(\mathrm{N}_3\right)_2(\mathrm{~s})$ will give $3 \times \frac{1}{221}$ $=0.014$ moles of $\mathrm{N}_2$
(b) Molar mass of $\left(\mathrm{NH}_4\right)_2 \mathrm{Cr}_2 \mathrm{O}_7=252 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{mol}$. 1 mole of $\left(\mathrm{NH}_4\right)_2 \mathrm{Cr}_2 \mathrm{O}_7$ will give 1 mole of $\mathrm{N}_2$ hence $\frac{1 \mathrm{~g}}{252 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{mol}}$ moles of $\left(\mathrm{NH}_4\right)_2 \mathrm{Cr}_2 \mathrm{O}_7$ will give $1 \times \frac{1}{252}=0.0039$ moles of $\mathrm{N}_2$
(c) Molar mass of $\mathrm{NH}_3=17 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{mol}$. 2 mole of $\mathrm{NH}_3$ will give 1 mole of $\mathrm{N}_2$
hence $\frac{1 \mathrm{~g}}{17 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{mol}}$ moles of $\mathrm{NH}_3$ will give
$$
\frac{1}{2 \times 17}=0.0297 \text { moles of } \mathrm{N}_2 \text {. }
$$
(d) Molar mass of $\mathrm{NH}_4 \mathrm{NO}_3=80 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{mol}$. 1 mole of $\mathrm{NH}_4 \mathrm{NO}_3$ will give 1 mole of $\mathrm{N}_2$ hence $\frac{1 \mathrm{~g}}{80 \mathrm{~g} / \mathrm{mol}}$ moles $\mathrm{NH}_4 \mathrm{NO}_3$ will give
$$
1 \times \frac{1}{80}=0.0125 \text { moles of } \mathrm{N}_2
$$
Hence Thermal decomposition of $\mathrm{NH}_3$ will produce maximum amount of $\mathrm{N}_2$.
